scenarioDescription:
The HD 21411 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 21411 is a star with 0.89 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 95.02 light years away from the solar system.

HD 21411 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 21411 system


HD 21411 b

HD 21411 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2019-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 21411 b is 65.934 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 21411 b is 9.520 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 21411 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 21411, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 21411 - System With 1 Exoplanet
